meanings.definition: To transfer goods from one ship to another.
meanings.sent1: The sailors transships the cargo carefully.
meanings.sent2: The workers transships the supplies efficiently at the port.
meanings.sent3: Why did the captain transships the bananas onto the wrong vessel?
meanings.sent4: The crane transships the containers like a giant hand moving toys.
meanings.sent5: The storm forced them to transships the goods swiftly to avoid sinking.

meanings.definition: The act of transferring goods from one ship to another.
meanings.sent1: The transships of the cargo was completed before sunset.
meanings.sent2: The transships of the oil was a crucial operation for the company.
meanings.sent3: The transships of the animals turned into a chaotic scene on the dock.
meanings.sent4: The transships of the packages resembled a well-choreographed dance.
meanings.sent5: The transships of the equipment was a sight to behold under the moonlight.
